website_summaries.verdict: Runners interested in tracking both heart-rate and all-day activities can't go wrong with the Forerunner 225.
pros: The Garmin Forerunner 225 has an always-on display, accurate GPS for tracking runs, a wrist-based heart-rate monitor, and can track steps and calories
It's water-resistant and can be worn in the shower and pool
cons: Heart-rate tracking is limited to workouts, there's no automatic syncing, sleep data lacks detailed information, and Garmin's mobile app is dated

customer_reviews.title: Totally fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Totally fantastic. Absolutelly better that the FitBit Charge. And much more accurate. I never use it to sleep because is too thick and unpleasant. The battery can last much longer if you disable GPS and Bluetooth. With those services activated, it last 1 week. Without those, almost 3. If you measure the ditances in meters, be carefull in set meters as you default unit. And in the watch you have to modify the mile unit because after you set to meters, it keeps recording in miles. On minor thing: the screen is not that bright as it shows the picture, but you can read it perfectly in daylight and during the night.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo G. Cardey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Works okay, till you start sweating, then heart rate goes crazy, jumps to 180 and stays there unless you take if off, dry off the back, then put it back on. Wore it during a stress test recently with totally messed up readings. The heart rate was off by as much as 20 beats per minute. GPS tracking is good, steps and distance are fairly accurate. I own two of these and heart rate is totally different results between them even when worn at the same time. Not at all worth the price. Even though it is water proof, as stated earlier, if it gets wet on the back, heart rate reading is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lucius

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch, So-so software
customer_reviews.text: I'm the kind of runner who wants distance/heart rate/time and that's it. I don't care about all the other extras. This watch gives me that information easily and it has since the moment I took it out of the box. It's a great quick start watch. In the big picture I gave it 4 stars because the garmin app and software, in my opinion, is not easy to use. I don't like it. And I don't think Garmin has a very consumer-friendly approach to their software.....more interested in making $$$ than making sure their customers can use their products with various apps/across the board.
customer_reviews.author: asny1234

customer_reviews.title: Best running watch and daily wear.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as an upgrade from my 210, this is a far superior watch. It is so nice to be able to wear it every day as well as for runs. Battery charges quickly and lasts a very long time. It integrates with my training schedule and tracks zones much more effectively than previously. One thing that surprised me was that I'd thought that I would miss the touch screen. I DO NOT!!! In fact, I love that it is not a touch screen watch!!! It is far easier to operate and does not inadvertently activate or change screens. I cannot recommend this watch highly enough. If I lost it today, I would replace it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: mazzas

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, even greater with a couple of updates in the next firmware push.
customer_reviews.text: After owning a Fitbit Surge and returning it because it failed due to light moister, the Forerunner 225 was a great replacement. Heart rate is pretty accurate and I haven't gotten a rash on my wrist like I did with the Fitbit Surge. Also resists moister much better than the Fitbit or Apple iWatch. The reason for the 4 stars is because it lacks a cycling feature (I wouldn't care if it was a basic one) and if you're not careful, you can accidentally pause your workouts with the red button. A screen lock feature would be great, hopefully Garmin pushes one in their next firmware update.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Munoz

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this watch! I can't recommend it enough for both beginner and advanced runners. This watch has got me out on those days when I didn't want to run because I wanted to see consistent data on my Garmin Connect app. I am a visual person, so I really enjoy the maps. I have also noticed that this is helping me with consistent pace (something that has never been my strength in running).
customer_reviews.author: Caitlynn Leary

customer_reviews.title: It's been flawless for the 2 years I have owned it and very comfortable. The only thing that has broken is the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not really a runner, but I thought this watch might motivate me to be more active and it has. It's been flawless for the 2 years I have owned it and very comfortable. The only thing that has broken is the strap keeper after almost 2 years, and you can pickup new bands for this for $10. The battery still lasts about a week when you are not using gps.
customer_reviews.author: William Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Not as intuitive as I would like, but once you get the hang of it
customer_reviews.text: Not as intuitive as I would like, but once you get the hang of it, it works well. Interestingly I get inconsistent distance readings when using it and my Forerunner 305. Sometimes shows longer distance covered sometimes less. Usually differences are small, less than .2 of a mile over a mile and half course. Sometimes they are both the same. Same result using Runkeeper app on my phone. Not sure why that is. There were also differences between Runkeeper app and Forerunner 305
customer_reviews.author: Astro

customer_reviews.title: Finally upgraded from my FR10
customer_reviews.text: I finally retired my Garmin FR10 and purchased this Garmin FR225. I wanted a GPS tracker that had a heart rate monitor built in to the wrist. It works great and I love how you do not have to sit around waiting to get a signal like I had to do with my FR10. It seems that whenever I ready to go, my Garmin is also ready to go. That alone is worth it! I have had great experiences with my Garmin products so I plan to continue to use them - brand loyalty right?
customer_reviews.author: Kurt E. Saberg

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you want to exercise for more than an hour/day and you don't want to charge it once or twice a day!!
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect during 13 months, delivering all specifications and resources for my running, BUT....it was gone. I strongly recommend not to buy this product if you want to exercise for more than an hour, and don't want to charge it every day! Something happened out of the blue and now I am getting a blank screen with absolutely no further notice! Sometimes battery level is at 85%, sometimes is at 53% and sometimes when I start to charge it the % of battery level start to decrease!
customer_reviews.author: George R. Stein

customer_reviews.title: the first month everything seem good, distance
customer_reviews.text: I use this watch for running. the first month everything seem good, distance, pace look accurate. started from second month, I feel the pace is not accurate. One day when I had a chance running together with my friend who was using his forerunner 235, the pace from my 225 showed 855 but my friend 235 shows 805! After power off my watch and turn on again, my 225 seemed back to normal for a few days, and then goes wrong again! the worse thing is, this watch is not longer eligible to return or replace, since it was purchased over 30 days!
customer_reviews.author: Xianbao He

customer_reviews.title: This is a greatwatch. I live in Japan
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch. I live in Japan, and the GPS works wonderfully. The only problem I have is that the heartrate sensor doesn't seem very accurate. Sometimes in the middle of a run, it drops down to the 60s, but after a minute or two it'll go back to regular. Or sometimes it has my heart rate as going too fast. I've tried all the different things people have said about putting it on tighter, or higher on the wrist etc. But the heartrate sensor wasn't the reason I bought it, it was just a perk anyways. Everything else, I love about the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Tak 30s

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE everything about this watch. I am a small woman and my wrists are very small but I wear this as an everyday watch, not just for running. It took getting use to its size but as I said I LOVE everything about it!!! I had a Fitbit Surge and a Garmin Fenix before this and like this watch much better. My only complaint is that you can't log walks, just runs but that isn't a really big deal!!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: The optical HR and Bluetooth rocks. Very happy with this one
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Garmin 410 and this is a great update. The in-built optical HR monitor and the Bluetooth capability to sync directly with the phone is a big mighty positive. I don't care too much about smart watch based notifications and this one (with only the activity tracking) fits right in the bill. I highly recommend this one (provided it is still in production)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garmin FR 225. Good watch for runners, but consider the FR 235 instead.
customer_reviews.text: I'd recommend to invest a bit more and go for the FR 235 with the 2nd generation built in heart rate monitor, larger screen (but same watch size), smaller and better charger design, and many other new features. It was released only 6 months or so later than the FR 225, and it is what the FR 225 should have been in the first place. For details on both, and the list of new features, you can read the in depth evaluations by DCRAINMAKER.com
customer_reviews.author: FLmiami

customer_reviews.title: Great watch that is also a fitness tracker with heart rate monitor built in
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a fitness watch that looked like a watch. I like to run so this was a natural choice for me and it is not bulky like other alternatives with similar features. Very happy with my purchase so far and the battery life is incredible. My old fitness tracker needed to be charged daily and this last more than a week per charge.
customer_reviews.author: M. Haitham

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, like all the garmin products
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, like all the garmin products. Simple to use. Good battery life. GPS is very accurate and gets hooked much faster than older version. Not 5-star, just 4, because the wrist-based heart rate sensor is not hairy-wrist-friendly. Measurement of the heart rate was all over the place even if I was wearing the watch very tightly. The fix: wear the watch on the inside. The inside of the wrist has no hair and gives a much better reliable reading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too big for a woman's wrist
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to get this watch...but it's huge, wayyyyy too big for a woman's wrist! It's so big it looks ridiculous on me. If you're only planning to wear it while you run then it would be fine, but I was planning to wear it 24/7. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: SW Pa buyer

customer_reviews.title: A great running watch
customer_reviews.text: Accurate. Counts steps well. Love the GPS function. Very accurate and fast to hook up to the satellite. The software gives you plenty to analyse. It is bulky. Won't got under the sleeves of some of my long sleeved shirts. Have used it swimming. Love that it is waterproof. A very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS Watch with One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Great GPS Watch for running. One problem I've had however using this watch for 1 year+. The metal charging contacts located on the back of the watch tend to rust after particularly sweaty runs. The rust can build up enough to prevent the watch from charging and connecting to this computer. A quick cleaning with any solvent and q tips solves the problem, but annoying non the less.
customer_reviews.author: Randy M

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky for small wrists!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, & loved the features, the brightness of the screen, & the way you can set workouts on the Garmin app to run on the watch. The reason for 4 stars is because I'm 5" tall & have tiny wrists. This was too bulky for my wrists, & uncomfortable at times. More of a mans size watch.
customer_reviews.author: TMRT

customer_reviews.title: It's a fairly sturdy time piece for everyday wear with little extras
customer_reviews.text: Has many of the items a runner, walker or bike rider would want. It's a fairly sturdy time piece for everyday wear with little extras, the battery life is incredible as far as a GPS sports watch goes. Only regret was I didn't see the 235 first, it had a few more features I could have used.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Laighton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Running Watch
customer_reviews.text: Perfect watch for me. I only run, so I do not need the biking and swimming features. For running, it is comfortable, finds the GPS very quickly even though I live in a remote area, and I love the fact that I can sit it by my phone after my run and have all of the details download to the phone. I actually have started using the calendar on my phone app while training for races where I used to keep hand-written calendars. Great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Running on Empty?
customer_reviews.text: This is my first running-watch and I like it -- reasonably comfortable, display is readable and GPS can be accurate. Note that I say 'can be': When I wore it as specified (outside of arm and up from wrist), it was off by nearly 0.2 miles at the end of a measured 13.1. Per a blog suggestion, I rotated it to the inside of my arm and it has been dead-on (+/- 1 meter over measured courses) ever since -- go figure.
customer_reviews.author: dANA bOOTH

customer_reviews.title: Combines old Garmin and basic Fitbit into one
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use with just one button to stop/start. I had an older Garmin which required me to swipe the bevel to access different screens for data. I also had a basic Fitbit. This device combines my old Garmin and basic Fitbit into one. I like that I can get my heart rate without a chest strap. This one device tracks my mileage, heart rate, steps (and daily step goal), aerobic zone along with a beep/vibrate to remind me to move throughout the day. The backups/sync are automatic when I charge it and the charge lasts for days. I would purchase this device again.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre

customer_reviews.title: Very good!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what i wanted, have been using it for a month or two. No discount on thanksgiving but never regret buying it. I use it to monitor my heart rate when running and the GPS was amazing. The garmin connect app is perfect as well. I track my sleeping condition everyday and whit this watch my living condition has been improving as I become more statistically rational about myself.
customer_reviews.author: Keqin He

customer_reviews.text: Everything I though I was getting and more, plus all the stuff I haven't figured out yet. I'll come back and make it five stars once I figure out how to make it connect to my phone via bluetooth. Mine simply won't. But I can connect it to my laptop via the charging cord supplied.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not a good treadmill watch
customer_reviews.text: Not intended for treadmill use even though it is listed as a feature. Also the battery will die even though it says its fully charged. I had charged it the other day before a run on the road. It said 84 percent when i left and 30 minutes into my run it died and shut off. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sarah denton jones

customer_reviews.title: Runner and Heart Attack Survivor
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. It's not perfect though, when I get super sweaty it throws the heart rate way up so I have to take the watch off and wipe it down. But overall I love not having to wear the chest strap. I keep track of my heart rate when I run and throughout the day as I am recovering from a heart attack a few months ago...healthy 39 years old, you never can tell.
customer_reviews.author: lnfitz

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy the garmin connect dashboard on my phone and web
customer_reviews.text: the watch does everything as advertised. I really enjoy the garmin connect dashboard on my phone and web, as well how it syncs with myfitness pal, and training peaks. I have downloaded several workouts to the watch, and then the watch prompts me through as I go, very helpful and not hard to learn how to use. My issue was price/functionality versus a fully functional smart watch. I think the jury is still out, as the Garmin watch becomes just a watch in between my workouts, but a smart watch is useful for both.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Levine

customer_reviews.title: ... is my 4 Garmin and I was expecting a better outcome from previous issues in the past
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4 Garmin and I was expecting a better outcome from previous issues in the past. In less than 2 months the watch batteries was discharging in 24 hours, multiple issues with software updates, the watch turns off by itself. Needless to say" it is not worth the cost" and aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Celso W. DaSilveira

customer_reviews.title: Just Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome doesn't even begin to cover it. Best watch I've used/reviewed so far. The ease of navigation alone makes it worth the money. The features are just the best. The CS in top notch so have no fears about seeking guidance if you think you may need to.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the best
customer_reviews.text: Great features but it has a issue of trying to go into low power moe right in the middle of a run. About every 10 minutes keeps trying to shut down.
customer_reviews.author: Fred is not dead

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the watch about a year. No problems until recently. It shuts off in the middle of a run it buzzez for hours then stops. For the money you would think it would last longer! dio
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Polk

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for his birthday. He loves it. He uses it to track his runs and it works perfectly. Synching with his iPhone goes without a hitch. It's comfortable as well. The HR monitor seems to be accurate as well.
customer_reviews.author: BookAddict12

customer_reviews.title: Awesome GPS watch
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves everything about this watch. I know some reviews say it wont link, but we have not had that issue. The heart rate monitor is pretty consistent. And she loves the cadence counter. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: moms stuff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect running watch!
customer_reviews.text: This watch has everything I have been looking for in a running watch for a few years now. Tracks outdoor runs and indoor runs perfectly without the need for a shoe pod indoors. Heart rate tracking and the vibrate alerts work perfectly. Absolutely love this device. Well done Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Iyishla Campbell

customer_reviews.title: It has other nice features like the auto scroll
customer_reviews.text: Only had the watch 2 weeks. It acquires the location signal very quickly. It has other nice features like the auto scroll. Like other heart rate monitors, it needs some sweat to work accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Willow C

customer_reviews.title: holy hell this watch is amazing!! I had the old Forerunner 405 before ...
customer_reviews.text: holy hell this watch is amazing!! I had the old Forerunner 405 before so this is a massive upgrade. I love the heart rate monitor being built in, and battery life is amazing for a watch with so many features. bluetooth connectivity works pretty well and linking garmin connect to strava means I get really good analytics of my runs.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch so much. I had considered an Apple watch, but the battery life on the Forerunner is just awesome. I am training for my fourth half-marathon and the watch is already helping to improve my average pace no end. The only downside is that it does take a minute or so to pick up the satellite signal. I use the time to warm up!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine W

customer_reviews.title: Terrible watch. I've had 2 in 2 months and ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible watch. I've had 2 in 2 months and both have frozen causing me to do a hard reset and loosing all my data about 2-3 times a day. Do not buy this watch!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rtesbj

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is that the bluetooth connection doesn't seem ...
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that the bluetooth connection doesn't seem to work. I tried multiple devices, but none could pair with the watch. Just know that you're going to have to connect to a PC with a wire to sync activities.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas K. Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Product! It does everything I need! Do not wear in a pool or in salt water. Garmin replaced mine while under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Forerunner 225 Spot on!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great running watch, and has some activity tracking as well. Having the built-in heart rate monitor is a great feature and provides useful data through garmin connect that I didn't previuosly have since it was too cumbersome to wear the heart rate strap from my previous watch. A great value for the features at this price point. Well done Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient and easy to use and to get used to. Two small remarks - I wish the texts on screen were larger. Another feature to add to the wish list is an option to have the alarm clock with vibrations only, and no sound - my partner does not wish to wake up at 5:00 0 AM...
customer_reviews.author: Assafkl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect watch for our needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect watch for our needs; just wish it were easier/possible to load multiple user profiles for persons of different age/height/weight and segregated record keeping.
customer_reviews.author: --jl--

customer_reviews.title: He thinks it's the greatest. Thank
customer_reviews.text: Totally made my husband's Christmas to get this watch. He is continually reporting me to all the data that it provides. He thinks it's the greatest. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Cathy A Caveney

customer_reviews.title: I have a different Garmin and love their products
customer_reviews.text: Gift for wife. She loves it so far. I have a different Garmin and love their products, great customer support and the GPS function works better than another other model I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. Had a 620 and you'd like I'd miss some of the functions from the 620 but I don't. Does everything I need. Love having the heart rate monitor on my wrist rather than with a strap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.  Accurate heartrate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life but it needed a full day to charge up. I have problems connecting it to my S8 via bluetooth but PC setup is easy. So, I sync it went I'm charging it.
customer_reviews.author: William B

customer_reviews.title: item as ordered and good price. The wristband is one of the best ...
customer_reviews.text: item as ordered and good price. The wristband is one of the best I've had. Soft and flexible. Use as everyday time piece in addition to the GPS function. Would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Big Duck

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: One day I switched it on and nothing was working, gps, Bluetooth, sounds. I was about to return the watch. I just had to press the power button for 15 seconds and reset it. Now it works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Fabrizio

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality watch
customer_reviews.text: We bought this model in January of this year 2017, and the heartbeat reader no longer works, in addition 3 buttons must be pressed very hard for them to perform their function
customer_reviews.author: Dag Teje

customer_reviews.title: Great but it's a problem to charge it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch but charging it is a big problem to charge it. The charge station is very sensible and constantly disconnects. When I get it to stay connected, it starts to discharge until it runs out of battery. This has happened since I got it and I had try charging it connected to a computer and to the wall. It takes me a lot of tries to get it to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Pablo Cuellar

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my teenage daughter who is on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my teenage daughter who is on the high school track and cross country teams. Fits well, works well. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: andreao35

customer_reviews.title: My run today with it was amazing. I really enjoy the constant heart rate monitoring ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this watch in the mail today. I have previously being using the Nike plus gps watch. This was a huge upgrade in comparison to that. My run today with it was amazing. I really enjoy the constant heart rate monitoring while running. Overall this is a great product. I was worried it would be too bulky on my wrist but it is a lot smaller than the Nike watch I previously had.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Morley

customer_reviews.title: Get the 235 instead
customer_reviews.text: I love Garmin but the 225 just needs to be trashed. It's heart rate sensor just doesn't work well. Garmin was exceptional in their service and quickly helped me upgrade to the 235 which is 100% better.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. The only problem is it has incorrect measurement of running distance indoor
customer_reviews.author: Lilly X

customer_reviews.title: 225 GPS
customer_reviews.text: What I not like is how large it is. I do like the fact that pace time and distance is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS watch 🕙
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch for my wife and she absolutely loves it... Does everything you could ever want out of a GPS watch... And it's very easy to use... The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the battery life doesn't last as long as they claim... But it's no prob to recharge it at night... So buy this watch and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There are better options.
customer_reviews.text: The thickness the face makes its a bit clunky and the Bluetooth pairing is not always easy on my Android. I knew with a wrist HR monitor that it wouldn't be as accurate as a chest strap and it's not. But it's fairly close and the GPS works well. So it's a solid purchase if you catch it on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Love the Garmin 225!
customer_reviews.text: As a female, I was nervous that the face would be too large - it may be for an everyday watch for a more petite woman, but has been perfect for me. I love that it has an internal heart-rate monitor. If I had one complaint, it would be the band, which seems to come out of the rubber holder too often.
customer_reviews.author: Leenee

customer_reviews.title: Fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need it to do, works perfectly, and very comfortable to wear while running.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: It takes a bit of time to master the button options but once you work through the on-line manual, it's great. The watch exceeds my expectations and I really love not having to wear a chest strap for my heart rate info.
customer_reviews.author: justareadingcat

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool! I love it, it's light, and the features along that come with the app are excellent. Still trying to figure out the heart rate feature, but overall super pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: C. Deane

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product from a great seller. Im very happy and on my way to great health again with this watch linked to the myfitness app. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size is bulky but it's very accurate and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Size is bulky but it's very accurate and easy to operate. You have two screens with 3 different data info and you can set it how you would like. I like the heart rate alerts as well.
customer_reviews.author: 5hoodlums

customer_reviews.title: Good, but too big for me
customer_reviews.text: Good , but too big for me. Wish they have women's size.
customer_reviews.author: Jade251

customer_reviews.title: HRM not accurate. Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: The HRM is practically useless as it is way too inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running watch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running watch. Battery life great. Galloway interval option. GPS is quick and sensitive for running between high building in the city.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Perez-Zayas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, probably overkill for a new runner but have used it almost every day
customer_reviews.author: CMH

customer_reviews.title: Time to tune in, tone up, get down ...
customer_reviews.text: Time to tune in, tone up, get down. You can't improve what you can't control. You can't control what you can't measure. Your porsche has a dashboard, you should have one too.
customer_reviews.author: rose cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Garmin  225 rocks
customer_reviews.text: What an improvement from the 630. Better wrist band and better interface.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift. My son loves it. Easy to use. Looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: L Moody

customer_reviews.title: Amazing running device
customer_reviews.text: Really nice device, it helps a lot with training. i used for my first half marathon and it help me a lot. very comfortable. The HR mechanism is really great, but if your hand is to sweaty it can be a little off the chart.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Coello

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Same-day delivery, perfect fit, heart rate from the wrist (no strap), and GPS signal in less than 10 seconds. Need I say more...
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: This watch was perfect for my wife
customer_reviews.text: This watch was perfect for my wife. She got into running about a year ago and needed a way to track her runs. The battery lasts several days versus her phone not even making it through the run before dying.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Like all Garmin products this one is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Like all Garmin products this one is amazing, BUT it does not wirelessly sync to Samsung S4 phone. Heart rate feature is great as well as the activity tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Sage

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This watch has everything I need for data driven motivation. It is simple, direct, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kentris

customer_reviews.title: Constant reset needed.
customer_reviews.text: Battery seems to be an issue, it will go from 40% to dead in a matter of minutes, as well as the need to reset twice in the 1month of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this new watch. It is lighter than other versions, the battery lasts longer. Clear big numbers easy to read during a race. i gave it four stars instead of five because sometimes the heart monitor is not accurate and/or does not read the heart beats. Great price / performance ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana Gottfried

customer_reviews.title: It is OK, I think the usability part could ...
customer_reviews.text: It is OK, I think the usability part could be improved. It should be configurable to show HR and pace on the same screen.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I'm an intermediate runner...not new, and only ran one half. This watch does everything I need it to and syncs with Nike+. It's perfect!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Really like the garmin forerunner 225
customer_reviews.text: Really like the garmin forerunner 225....battery lasts more than 8 hrs...so easy to use - I just wanted a basic watch for interval training/ long runs and to check my heart rate..... recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Klinke

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over the 220. Heart rate monitor works really well for me. Strap should be a little longer and watch should be half the thickness.. Still more than happy I purchased it.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great running watch. Does have sleep mode like it says. Or maybe I can't find it.

customer_reviews.title: I cannot recommend this to anyone who runs
customer_reviews.text: The heart rate monitor function of this device is very erratic and unreliable. I cannot recommend this to anyone who runs, or cycles!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price point for this feature set
customer_reviews.text: Has all of the features I was looking for in a running watch. It occasionally needs to be repositioned on my wrist for accurate HR. Good price point for this feature set. I was happy to lose the chest strap HR monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It's a great watch, I use it for all my running
customer_reviews.text: It's a great watch, I use it for all my running, the battery life is very good, heart rate is an awesome feature, just overall a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: jayson geer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Very easy to use. Super intuitive design, perfect for first time GPS watch owners. Does the job and looks good as well. Very happy with this purcahse.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Used this right out of the box! Have had several Garmin running watches and this is the best I've used. Very easy to setup and a stat lovers dream, love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: makes gathering work-out data and downloading it easy. As much data as one reasonably needs including ...
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin 225, with its wrist based heart monitor, makes gathering work-out data and downloading it easy. As much data as one reasonably needs including sleep time, cadence, heart rate and more.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Harris

customer_reviews.title: It works well and meets my expectation. Just battery ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well and meets my expectation. Just battery life a bit short and GPS satellite locking requires longer than my expected time with around 3 minutes.

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate in the wrist works awesome! Freedom to run without a heart strap
customer_reviews.text: Heart rate in the wrist works awesome! Freedom to run without a heart strap. Display is dimmer than I'd like, but ok.

customer_reviews.text: After researching several running watches, I'm glad I picked the Garmin 225. No pairing issues like some others have mentioned. Its very comfortable and I it definately helping me dial in my pace and effort on runs.

product_meta.title: Garmin Forerunner 225
product_meta.description: Style:Base ModelKnow your zone with Forerunner 225 - the first Garmin GPS running watch with wrist-based heart rate. Now you have the option to run without a strap because this watch has a built-in sensor that measures heart rate at the wrist. A colorful gauge shows your zone and beats per minute at a glance: warm-up (gray), easy (blue), aerobic (green), threshold (orange) or maximum (red). Create customized workouts or download free training plans at Garmin Connect, send to your watch and get coach-like guidance. The 225 offers vibration alerts and a built-in accelerometer to record distance for treadmill workouts. Connected features include automatic uploads to Garmin Connect, live tracking and social media sharing.
feature_bullets: Colorful graphic interface shows your zone and beats per minute at a glance
Tracks distance, pace and heart rate¹*; activity tracking counts steps and calories all day
Connected features²: automatic uploads to Garmin Connect, live tracking, social media sharing
Compatible with advanced workouts and free training plans from Garmin Connect
Color is black with red accent
Unit Dimensions WxHxD : 11.3” x 1.9” x 0.6” (287 mm x 48 mm x 16 mm
Color is black with red accent
